newsitem.title: USA: Dow slips to session lows, techs edge off highs.
newsitem.headline: Dow slips to session lows, techs edge off highs.

text.p: U.S. stocks met with a round of selling in late afternoon, dragging the Dow industrials to session lows and pulling tech stocks from their peaks.

The Dow fell to 7881, off 41 points for the day, then quickly recouped about a third of its losses, as blue chips returned to their daily pattern of choppy late activity. The Nasdaq composite held to solid gains, up 14 points at 1517.
"This is looking like a typical last hour with the Dow," said Guy Truicko, portfolio manager at Unity Management.
"It seems like we have to go through these nearly 100 point swings every day."
Market breadth turned neutral, with advances holding only a marginal advantage on the NYSE.
U.S. Treasuries softened, with the benchmark 30-year bond off 9.32 to yield 6.55 percent.
